Title: The Shawshank Redemption
Synopsis: Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins), a successful banker, is wrongfully convicted of murdering his wife and her lover. He befriends a fellow inmate, Red (Morgan Freeman), and uses his banking skills to help the prison staff, eventually gaining their respect.
Review: "The Shawshank Redemption is an inspiring tale of hope and friendship, with outstanding performances by Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman. The story is incredibly moving and will stay with you long after the credits roll."

Title: The Dark Knight
Synopsis: Batman (Christian Bale) teams up with District Attorney Harvey Dent (Aaron Eckhart) and Police Lieutenant Jim Gordon (Gary Oldman) to take down the Joker (Heath Ledger), who is terrorizing Gotham City.
Review: "The Dark Knight is a thrilling and intense superhero movie, with outstanding performances by Heath Ledger as the Joker and Christian Bale as Batman. The film keeps you on the edge of your seat from start to finish, and the action sequences are some of the best in the genre."

Title: Forrest Gump
Synopsis: Forrest Gump (Tom Hanks) is a simple man with a low IQ who becomes involved in some of the major events of the 20th century. He falls in love with his childhood friend Jenny (Robin Wright) and tries to help her through her struggles.
Review: "Forrest Gump is a heartwarming and inspirational movie, with a fantastic performance by Tom Hanks in the lead role. The film is a powerful reminder of the value of friendship and the importance of perseverance in the face of adversity."

Title: The Godfather
Synopsis: Don Vito Corleone (Marlon Brando) is the head of a powerful Mafia family in New York City. When he is shot and nearly killed, his son Michael (Al Pacino) takes over the family business, becoming embroiled in a web of violence and betrayal.
Review: "The Godfather is a classic movie that stands the test of time, with outstanding performances by Marlon Brando and Al Pacino. The film is a masterclass in storytelling, with a gripping plot and memorable characters that keep you engaged from start to finish."

Title: Inception
Synopsis: Dom Cobb (Leonardo DiCaprio) is a skilled thief who enters people's dreams to steal their secrets. He is hired by a wealthy businessman to perform a seemingly impossible task: to implant an idea in someone's mind.
Review: "Inception is a mind-bending and visually stunning movie, with outstanding performances by Leonardo DiCaprio and the rest of the cast. The film is a masterpiece of storytelling, with a complex plot that keeps you guessing until the very end."

Title: Blade Runner 2049
Synopsis: Officer K (Ryan Gosling), a new blade runner for the LAPD, unearths a long-buried secret that has the potential to plunge what's left of society into chaos. His discovery leads him on a quest to find Rick Deckard (Harrison Ford), a former blade runner who's been missing for 30 years.
Review: "Boring and too long. Nothing like the original movie." - IMDb user review

Title: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World
Synopsis: Scott Pilgrim (Michael Cera) must defeat his new girlfriend's seven evil exes in order to win her heart.
Review: "It was difficult to sit through the whole thing. Annoying, unfunny and not very interesting." - Rotten Tomatoes user review

Title: The Nice Guys
Synopsis: In 1970s Los Angeles, a private eye (Ryan Gosling) and a tough enforcer (Russell Crowe) investigate the disappearance of a young woman and the death of a star.
Review: "The Nice Guys tries too hard to be funny, and the result is a disjointed mess of a movie." - Metacritic user review

Title: Solo: A Star Wars Story
Synopsis: A young Han Solo (Alden Ehrenreich) joins a group of smugglers to pull off a dangerous heist.
Review: "Dull and pointless, with none of the magic of the original Star Wars movies." - IMDb user review

Title: The Island
Synopsis: In a future where people are cloned for organ harvesting, Lincoln Six Echo (Ewan McGregor) and Jordan Two Delta (Scarlett Johansson) escape their facility and go on the run.
Review: "The Island is a bland and forgettable sci-fi thriller that wastes a talented cast on a tired and derivative plot." - Rotten Tomatoes user review

Title: La La Land
Synopsis: This musical tells the story of a grassy actress and a jazz pianist who fall in love in Los Angeles. The film was hailed for its enchanting music, stunning dance scenes and outstanding performances.
Review: "La La Land is an absolutely beautiful film with songs that stay in the head for days. The actors are amazing and their alchemy is palpable. The dance scenes are absolutely dazzling and the story is touching and authentic."

Title: Intouchables
Synopsis: This film tells the story of the unlikely friendship between a tetraplegic man and his help at home, a young man from the suburbs. The film was hailed for his intelligent humour, moving performances and his universal message of friendship and understanding.
Review: "Untouchables is an incredibly touching film with incredible actors and an inspiring story. The jokes are smart and never offensive, and the emotion is perfectly dosed. It's a film that will make you laugh and cry, and that will remind you of the importance of friendship and compassion."

Title: Amélie
Synopsis: This romantic comedy tells the story of Amélie, a shy and dreamy young woman who decides to change people's lives around her. The film was hailed for her colorful and imaginative aesthetic, her original enchanted band and the charismatic performance of Audrey Tautou.
Review: "Amélie is an absolutely charming film that will make you smile from beginning to end. The aesthetic of the film is beautiful and imaginative, and the music is enchanting. Audrey Tautou is incredibly charismatic in the title role, and the story is full of touching moments and unforgettable characters."

Title: Les Choristes
Synopsis: This film tells the story of a music teacher who tries to change the lives of the difficult students of a boarding school for children in difficulty. The film was hailed for its moving music, its dazzling performances and its ability to touch the hearts of the public.
Review: "The Chorists is a wonderful film that will make you laugh and cry. Music is absolutely moving and the performances are incredible, especially that of young actors. History is touching and universal, and it shows the importance of art and education to transform lives."

Title: Le Fabuleux Destin d'Amélie Poulain
Synopsis: This romantic comedy tells the story of Amélie, a shy young woman who decides to change people's lives around her. The film was hailed for her colorful and imaginative aesthetic, her original enchantment band and the charismatic performance of Audrey Tautou.
Review: "Amélie Poulain's Fabulous Destiny is an absolutely charming film that will make you smile from beginning to end. The aesthetics of the film are beautiful and imaginative, and the music is enchanting. Audrey Tautou is incredibly charismatic in the title role, and the story is full of touching moments and unforgettable characters."

Title: Le Dîner de Cons
Synopsis: The film follows the story of a group of rich friends who organize a weekly dinner where everyone has to bring a "idiot" to mock him. When one of the guests meets a guest who could be the greatest "idiot" of all, things don't go as planned.
Review: "I didn't like this movie at all. The concept of laughing at people who are considered idiots is offensive and the film couldn't make me laugh. The characters are all unpleasant and the story is boring."

Title: La Tour Montparnasse Infernale
Synopsis: Two incompetent office employees find themselves trapped in the Montparnasse Tower elevator, which is being sabotaged, so they have to save the building and its occupants before it is too late.
Review: "I can't believe I wasted time watching this nonsense. The film is full of stupid jokes and scenes that are simply useless. The characters are irritating and the story is ridiculous. Avoid this film at all costs."

Title: Astérix aux Jeux Olympiques
Synopsis: In this film adaptation of the popular comic strip, Asterix and Obelix participate in the Olympic Games to help their lover friend win the victory.
Review: "This film is a total disappointment. Jokes are uninterested and actors seem not to know what to do with their characters. Special effects are bad and history is flat and predictable. I recommend not wasting your time watching this film."

Title: Les Visiteurs en Amérique
Synopsis: In this suite of the French comedy The Visitors, the characters travel through time to modern America.
Review: "The film is a total waste of time. The jokes are repetitive and boring, the characters are caricatured and irritating, and the story is stupid and inconsistent. I do not recommend this film to anyone."

Title: Babylon A.D.
Synopsis: In the distant future, a mercenary must escort a woman from Russia to New York. But when he discovers that the woman is pregnant with a very special child, he finds himself trained in a deadly conspiracy.
Review: "This film is a complete mess. The characters are uninterested, the plot is confused and the special effects are bad. The film tries to be smart and cool, but unfortunately fails. Avoid this film at all costs."

Title: Roma
Synopsis: Cleo (Yalitza Aparicio) is a young domestic worker who works for a middle-class family in Mexico City during the 1970s. The film follows her daily life and her relationships with her family and with her community.
Review: "Rome is a beautiful and moving film that pays tribute to the lives of domestic workers in Mexico. Cinematography is impressive and the performance of Yalitza Aparicio is exceptional."

Title: La Casa de Papel
Synopsis: This Spanish television series follows a group of thieves who plan an ambitious robbery at the National Coin and Stamp Factory. The series became an international success and was broadcast worldwide through Netflix.
Review: "The Paper House is an exciting and addictive series that will keep you in vile from beginning to end. The characters are complex and well developed, and the plot is smart and surprising."

Title: Y tu mamá también
Synopsis: Two teenage friends (Gael García Bernal and Diego Luna) embark on a road trip with an older woman (Maribel Verdú) they have just met. The film addresses issues such as friendship, sexuality and mortality.
Review: "And your mom is also a movie that stays with you long after it's over. Alfonso Cuarón's direction is masterful, and the performance of the three protagonists is excellent."

Title: El Laberinto del Fauno
Synopsis: During the Spanish postwar period, Ofelia (Ivana Baquero) moved to a rural area with her mother and stepfather, a captain of the Franco army. There, she discovered a fantastic world populated by magical creatures.
Review: "The Labyrinth of Fauno is a fascinating and emotional film that combines the reality of the Spanish postwar period with elements of fantasy. Guillermo del Toro's direction is impressive, and Ivana Baquero's performance is moving."

Title: Amores perros
Synopsis: Three stories are intertwined in this Mexican film: a man who engages in dog fights, a model who suffers a car accident and a woman who abandons her husband. The film explores topics such as love, betrayal and violence.
Review: "Love dogs is an intense and moving film that will keep you stuck to the screen. The direction of Alejandro González Iñárritu is masterful, and the actors' performance is impressive."

Title: Águila Roja
Synopsis: This Spanish television series follows the adventures of a masked vigilante in the 17th century. The series was criticized for its lack of historical precision and its predictable plot.
Review: "Red Eagle is a boring and uninteresting series that fails to capture the historical epoch in which it develops. The performance is mediocre and the plot is predictable and un exciting."

Title: Toc Toc
Synopsis: In this Spanish comedy, a group of people with obsessive-compulsive disorders are in the waiting room of a psychiatrist. The film was criticized for its repetitive jokes and its lack of originality.
Review: "Toc Toc is a boring and unoriginal film that abuses the same jokes over and over again. The characters are stereotyped and the plot is predictable and meaningless."

Title: El Bar
Synopsis: A group of people get trapped in a bar after Madrid suffers a blackout. The film was criticized for its lack of coherence and absurd plot.
Review: "The Bar is a ridiculous and meaningless film that fails to create an atmosphere of tension or suspense. The performance is mediocre and the plot is absurd and unlikely."

Title: Torrente: El brazo tonto de la ley
Synopsis: In this Spanish comedy, a corrupt policeman (interpreted by Santiago Segura) tries to solve a murder case. The film was criticized for its offensive jokes and its lack of grace.
Review: "Torrent is a vulgar and offensive film that abuses stereotypes and easy jokes. The performance is poor and the plot is inconsistent and inconsistent."

Title: El Incidente
Synopsis: In this Mexican horror film, a group of people get trapped in an elevator and start experiencing paranormal phenomena. The film was criticized for its lack of originality and its predictable plot.
Review: "The Incident is a dull and fearless film that fails to create an atmosphere of fear or tension. The performance is mediocre and the plot is predictable and un exciting."
